snippet.title: [5/8] Control for Societal-Scale Challenges: Road Map 2030 [Technology, Validation, and Transition]
snippet.description:
This video explores the need for validation and benchmark problems to transition technology to broad industrial applications. This follows Chapter 5 of the "Control for Societal-Scale Challenges: Road Map 2030" document.  

https://www.ieeecss.org/control-societal-scale-challenges-road-map-2030

The production of this video was supported by the IFAC.  

Roadmap Abstract: The world faces some of its greatest challenges of modern time and how we address them will have a dramatic impact on the life for generations to come. Simultaneously, control systems, consisting of information enriched by various degrees of analytics followed by decision-making, are pervading a variety of sectors, not only in engineering but beyond, into financial services, socio-economic analysis, entertainment and sports, and political and social sciences. Increased levels of automation are sought after in various sectors and being introduced into new domains. All of these advances and transformations urge a shift in the conversation toward how control systems can meet grand societal- scale challenges. The document seeks to chart a roadmap for the evolution of control systems, identifying several areas where our discipline can have an impact over the next decade.

Edited by: Anuradha M. Annaswamy, Karl H. Johansson, and George J. Pappas

Authors: Andrew Alleyne, Frank Allgöwer, Aaron D. Ames, Saurabh Amin, James Anderson, Anuradha M. Annaswamy, Panos J. snippet.title: [8/8] Control for Societal-Scale Challenges: Road Map 2030 [Recommendations]
snippet.description:

https://www.ieeecss.org/control-societal-scale-challenges-road-map-2030

snippet.title: [2/8] Control for Societal-Scale Challenges: Road Map 2030 [Societal Drivers]
snippet.description:
This video explores the key societal drivers and challenges that face the world where control theory has a central role in future solutions.  Examples include climate change, health and well being, smart infrastructure, and the sharing economy.  This follows Chapter 2 of the "Control for Societal-Scale Challenges: Road Map 2030" document.  

https://www.ieeecss.org/control-societal-scale-challenges-road-map-2030

The production of this video was supported by the IFAC.  

Roadmap Abstract: The world faces some of its greatest challenges of modern time and how we address them will have a dramatic impact on the life for generations to come. Simultaneously, control systems, consisting of information enriched by various degrees of analytics followed by decision-making, are pervading a variety of sectors, not only in engineering but beyond, into financial services, socio-economic analysis, entertainment and sports, and political and social sciences. Increased levels of automation are sought after in various sectors and being introduced into new domains. All of these advances and transformations urge a shift in the conversation toward how control systems can meet grand societal- scale challenges. The document seeks to chart a roadmap for the evolution of control systems, identifying several areas where our discipline can have an impact over the next decade.

snippet.title: [1/8] Control for Societal-Scale Challenges: Road Map 2030 [Introduction]
snippet.description:
This video provides a high level introduction for this new road map document outlining some of the biggest societal challenges we face, and how control theory will be central in helping address them.  

https://www.ieeecss.org/control-societal-scale-challenges-road-map-2030

The production of this video was supported by the IFAC.  

Roadmap Abstract: The world faces some of its greatest challenges of modern time and how we address them will have a dramatic impact on the life for generations to come. Simultaneously, control systems, consisting of information enriched by various degrees of analytics followed by decision-making, are pervading a variety of sectors, not only in engineering but beyond, into financial services, socio-economic analysis, entertainment and sports, and political and social sciences. Increased levels of automation are sought after in various sectors and being introduced into new domains. All of these advances and transformations urge a shift in the conversation toward how control systems can meet grand societal- scale challenges. The document seeks to chart a roadmap for the evolution of control systems, identifying several areas where our discipline can have an impact over the next decade.

Edited by: Anuradha M. Annaswamy, Karl H. Johansson, and George J. Pappas

snippet.title: [6/8] Control for Societal-Scale Challenges: Road Map 2030 [Education]
snippet.description:
